title: From Vision to Sound: Advancing Audio Anomaly Detection with Vision-Based Algorithms
author: Manuel Barusco (University of Padova, Italy), Francesco Borsatti (University of Padova, Italy), Davide Dalle Pezze (University of Padova, Italy), Francesco Paissan (Italy), Elisabetta Farella (Fondazione Bruno Kessler, Italy), Gian Antonio Susto (University of Padova, Italy), ...
relevance_why: The paper provides insights into adapting visual anomaly detection techniques for audio anomaly detection. This could inform future methods in audio signal processing and potentially benefit Dr. Liu's research in audio quality enhancement.
background: Audio anomaly detection is the process of identifying unexpected or out-of-distribution sounds in audio sequences, which has implications in various domains like industrial monitoring and environmental surveillance.
contribution: This paper introduces a framework that leverages Visual Anomaly Detection methods to enhance Audio Anomaly Detection, achieving fine-grained localization of anomalies within audio spectrograms.

technical_comparison.prior_work: Previous methods often lack transparency in their predictions, providing only an overall anomaly score without identifying specific areas of interest.
technical_comparison.novelty: This work uses vision-based techniques to generate detailed anomaly maps, enabling users to locate and understand anomalies better.

key_innovation: The integration of visual anomaly detection algorithms with audio data allows for a more interpretable approach to anomaly detection through localized spectrogram analysis.
real_world_impact: By improving the explainability and performance of audio anomaly detection systems, this work has potential applications in industrial settings, enhancing safety and operational efficiency.
limitations: The performance may vary significantly based on the quality of the chosen feature extractor and may require further optimization for increased detection accuracy.

new_terms.Visual Anomaly Detection: **Visual Anomaly Detection** refers to methods that identify unusual patterns or anomalies within visual data, which typically involves machine learning techniques focusing on feature extraction and representation learning.
new_terms.fine-grained temporal-frequency localiza: **Fine-grained temporal-frequency localization** pertains to the ability to identify anomalies at distinct moments in time and specific frequency ranges, enhancing the granularity of anomaly detection.
